comments.body: Do you have info for how to run e2e against a specific cluster using the makefile? How to run a specific test with the ginkgo args? Essentially the same information that you added for the unit test invocations, but for e2e.

The Makefile target doesn't have ginkgo args (I'm assuming its because the ginkgo args are space separated and Makefile makes it a bit harder), but I added a link to the E2E testing guide in case people want to run customized tests.

diffHunk:

make test-integration # Run integration tests, requires etcd
make test-e2e # Run e2e tests
```

comments.body: This is really cool. Good to know.

comments.body:
Nit: These spaces appear unnecessary. 

But don't change it, or lgtm will be removed again. :-/
Would it be better to just have hack/verify-godeps.sh do a version check for diff? Then it's not a documentation issue but one that the script will find on its own and inform the user.

Yeah, I considered that approach too.  But there are so many cases of this sort of thing (tools where we implicitly rely on some 'recentish', dont-quite-know-which-version tool, and I don't even know a reliable way to check the versions.  Can perhaps try in a follow-up PR, but lets get this doc update in in the mean time.
Then maybe reword "It requires <xxx> version. And note that Mac OS X may not ship with this by default."
What 'version' do you suggest using above?

out-of-the-box.  Note that Mac OS X ships with somewhat outdated

comments.body: Flow with the added sentence is kind of funky, but I want people to expect that this commit hook will take a while. I was surprised the first time I tried to run this, as the description was "run gofmt", so I expected it to run instantly, not hang for a while.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +119,123 @@Before committing any changes, please link/copy the pre-commit hook
into your .git directory. This will keep you from accidentally
committing non-gofmt'd Go code. In addition this hook will do a build.

The hook requires both Godep and etcd on your `PATH`.

comments.body: To be honest - I think we do NOT officially support 1.5 Go (due to performance issues) - so we shouldn't mention it here.
If we run 1.6 in testing, it should require  >= 1.6.

That's not entirely true - currently we are running 1.4.2 and we officially do NOT support 1.5.X (but it is >= 1.4.2).

We need to explicitly specify versions that we are supporting.
I may fix that in a follow-up if you like
@luxas - can you fix that in this PR? I will re-apply gtlm label as soon as this is done
It merged already, will send a follow-up anyway

comments.body:
insert:

```
# Flags can be combined, and their actions will take place in this order:
# -build, -push|-up|-pushup, -test|-tests=..., -down
# e.g.:
go run e2e.go -build -pushup -test -down

# -v (verbose) can be added if you want streaming output instead of only
# seeing the output of failed commands.

# -ctl can be used to quickly call kubectl against your e2e cluster. Useful for
# cleaning up after a failed test or viewing logs.
go run e2e.go -ctl='get events'
go run e2e.go -ctl='delete pod foobar'
```
done.
